events.name: Chicago JobHack
events.about:
Why Hack?

Despite 12.5 million unemployed workers in the US, there are more than 3.5 million unfilled jobs. Do you have the next big idea to help match the right talent with the right opportunity? CareerBuilder.com wants to help you make it.

We’re looking for the best hackers: software engineers, web developers, data scientists, designers, project managers, and community organizers. Come hang with our API developers and Mobile/Social teams for the weekend and we’ll teach you how to use our APIs to access the most comprehensive job data out there. And since we’ve been in the business for a while, we have a lot of data to help your imagination run wild.  Find new ways to use our historical data from job postings, employee supply & demand trends, compensation data, as well as job recommendation and career pathing engines.

Sounds pretty awesome, right? Well, it gets awesomer: there will definitely be prizes. And, because we’re pretty new to this kind of events, you probably have a great chance to win one.

  • $2000 prize for best overall
  • Two $1,000 prizes for best delivered concepts (or maybe just most complete, depending on where people are by the end)
  • Plus, we’ll have tasty treats and buckets o’ beer throughout the event. (Well, maybe not in the mornings. Take it easy, cowboy.)

 As far as we’re concerned, the more people we have creating solutions to unemployment, the better off we’ll all be. So, come join us, we’re pumped to see what we can create together.

 Tweet questions and comments to #JobHack, or email me!

Rough Schedule

Saturday, October 27

  • 9 AM          Registration and coffee
  • 9:30 AM     Welcome and intro to API
  • 10 AM        Split into teams and hack
  • Noonish      Lunch
  • Afternoon   Still hacking
  • 3 PM          Beers and last sprint of the day
  • 6 PM          You dont have to go home, but you cant stay here

Sunday, October 28

  • 9 AM          Coffee
  • 9:30 AM     Hack
  • Noonish      Lunch
  • Afternoon   Still hacking
  • 3:30 PM     Deadline and three-minute demo
  • 5 PM          Judging
  • 5:30 PM     Winners and prizes

Terms

Finally, our legal team wanted us to lay out some expectations that you need to check out if you participate (sorry, gotta do it!). Basically just agreeing that you won’t be jerks, we won’t be jerks, that you own your IP from the event, and that everything we create suring the weekend is Open Source BSD 2-Clause licensed. If you have questions about what any of that means, please get in touch!

That’s it! Best of luck. And we look forward to seeing you soon.

events.name: HACK-A-FUNNEL Marketing Hackathon Fall 2012 Chicago, IL
events.about:
Join us for HACK-A-FUNNEL

a Marketing Hackathon for B2B Emerging and Growth-Stage Tech Companies

The marketing hackathon invites a group of business managers and marketers to gather together to exchange ideas, tips, and best practices in a problem-solving environment.

Learn from leaders who have created successful programs that leverage demand-focused activities for growth, and then hack away at your own goals in small groups.
  
The theme is Mining and Hacking the Lead Management Funnel for B2B Marketers

The two-day event will include:

  • Presentations with interactive education models that help marketers to acquire, nurture, and convert relevant leads for their business
  • Breakfast and Lunch Friday and Saturday
  • Cocktail Event Friday evening 

Confirmed speakers include Gini Dietrich, Andy Crestodina, Mana Ionescu, Steve Susina, Mitchell Neirick, Collin Canright, and Marketing Hackathon founder Marti Konstant

For more information, visit our website: www.marketing-hackathon.com

All registration fees are Non Refundable

events.name: No Limit Code'Em
events.about:
Enova Presents No Limit Code‘Em:

A Chicago Wide Hackathon for Currently Enrolled Students!

No Limit CodeEm is a citywide coding competition for currently enrolled students in the Chicagoland area. Prizes will go to 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place winners (see below for our awesome prize list). Students are eligible to compete individually or in pairs, so feel free to come on your own or bring a friend!

Who Should Attend:

Students currently enrolled at the following universities:

·         University of Chicago

·         Northwestern

·         DePaul

·         Purdue

·         Loyola

·         Starter League

Note: A valid student ID will be required upon check in. Bachelors, Masters, and PhD students are all eligible to participate.

Prizes:

1st Place:  MacBook Air

2nd Place:  iPad

3rd Place:  iTunes $100 Gift Card

Registration Raffle:

By registering for this event you are eligible to win a brand new pair of Bose headphones

About Us:

Enova is a web-based consumer lending company located in downtown Chicago.  What began as a dynamic management team, with roots in Silicon Valley and Wall Street, has grown at a tremendous pace since its inception. Today, we are proud to have over 800 Enova team members serving millions of customers in the United States, United Kingdom, Australia, and Canada.

We’re hiring! To check out our latest openings, click here.

Questions?

E-mail us at contact@enova.com.

events.name: Nokia Hackathon by MonkeyBars
events.about:
Most products take days, weeks, or months of designing, building, and testing to release to market...

Youre gonna do it in 24 hours.

HOW?

Using your teams kickass skills, youre gonna slave through the night and make the best app possible.

WHY?

Why not? Theres a few thousand dollars in cash and tons of prizes from our sponsors lying around. Did we mention there were possible internships/job ops too? Most importantly though, youre gonna meet like minded people to bounce your awesome ideas off of and discover what you are truly capable of.

WHEN/WHERE?

October 20th @ 3 PM in IITs Ideashop (check the map below). Youll be going on until 5 PM the next day.

I NEED FOOOD!

 To keep your bellies happy, weve planned out some good food (none of that pizza/mountain dew, sorry coders) to keep you going throughout the night.

events.name: Data Camp Fall 2012
events.about:
Data is everywhere. Learn how to use it. 

Today the social sector is surrounded by mountains of useful data, but for many individuals and organizations uncovering the insights buried in that data can seem either too difficult or too expensive.

It doesn’t have to be that way.

Free, flexible, and easy-to-use data tools, along with helpful community resources, are making it possible for anyone to turn messy and meaningless data into beautiful and meaningful insights, without the big bucks or the PhD. All that’s needed is a little spark to help get the data fire started.

Thats why we created Data Camp. 

Data Camp is a day-and-a-half crash course in online and open source data tools for beginners. With the help of Chicago-area data professionals and enthusiasts, Data Campers are led through a project that introduces them to a core set of data tools to clean, manage, store, explore, analyze, and visualize almost any dataset.

 

Schedule

Thursday, October 18th (optional)

  • 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm
  • Help Session: Getting set up with R, RStudio, & Google Refine

Friday, October 19th 

  • 8:30 am - 5:00 pm
  • Programming Basics, Data Storage, Cleaning, & Exploration

Saturday, October 20th

  • 8:30 am - 12:00 pm
  • Analysis and Visualization

 

What You can Expect to Learn

  • Cleaning data with Google Refine
  • Storing & accessing data in the cloud using Fusion Tables
  • Exploring and analyzing data using RStudio
  • Visualizing data using ggplot2, Google Visualization API, & Tableau Public
  • Publishing data visualizations to the web
  • Talking with a computer through a command line interface, writing scripts and functions 

Data Camp is Co-sponsored by:

The Harris School of Public Policy, The Center for Impact Measurement, Data Potluck, Emphanos, Data Analysis for the Public Good, Open Government Hack Night, and the Chicago Data Visualization Group

 

FAQs

Do I need prior programming experience for Data Camp?

No. Data Camp is indented to be an indtroductory course and will assume no prior programming knowledge. Hoever, some familiarity with data (e.g. excel spreadsheets) and a basic understanding of statistics (means, variances, correlations) will be helpful.

 

What should I bring to the event?

Your laptop. This is going to be a hands-on workshop with every participant should bring a laptop in order to get the most out of it. 

Will food be provided?

Coffee on Friday morning and lunch on Friday at noon will both be provided. 

What is the refund policy?

You can cancel up to 48 before the event and still recieve a full refund.

events.name: App Challenge Chicago – Hosted by Singly and Braintree
events.about:
Explore Cool APIs – Create Cool Apps

We are bringing together the Chicago tech community for a weekend of hacking – but not just hacking. This event is about taking an idea from pitch to launch in one day. Our judges are looking for shippable products – ones wed be proud to show to our investors.

Chicagos best and brightest developers, designers and entreprenuers will be at App Challenge Chicago. Join them – along with some really cool sponsors, speakers and judges – for a weekend of working, playing, eating and drinking. And, of course, tons of cool prizes.

How does it work?

Whether you have a team locked in or youre flying solo, youll have time Saturday morning to pitch your idea and recruit the talent you need. Whether youre building a viral web app or a cross-platform enterprise startup, the competitions going to be stiff, so youre going to need talent.

Once teams and ideas are formed, youll have about 24 hours to build an app thats ready for judging.

Press inquiries, sponsorship inquiries or general questions?

Email: austin@singly.com

Prizes: 

Overall Winner:

 MacBook Pro with Retina Display

Best use of Singlys API:

 TBA (But its gonna be awesome)

Best use of Braintree/Venmo:

 TBA (But its gonna be awesome)

Easter egg prizes throughout event:

 RC Helicopters, Spheros, t-shirts + stickers

Sponsors:


 

Schedule:

Saturday, September 29

  • 10:00 AM – Registration + Coffee
  • 10:30 AM – Pitches!
  • 11:00 AM – Form teams and start hacking
  • 1:00 PM – Lunch
  • 6:30 PM – Dinner, provided by Path.To
  • Midnight-ish – You dont have to go home, but you cant stay here.

Sunday, September 30

  • 10:00 AM – Doors open + coffee
  • 12:30 PM – All projects must be submitted
  • 1:30 PM – Demos
  • 3:00 PM – Judging
  • 3:30 PM – Winners announced

events.name: Hackathon for Social Good - Chicago
events.about:
Join web and mobile experts on Wed., Sept. 26th  in an all day Hackathon for Social Good. Hackathons are events when programmers and designers meet to work collaboratively to build programs and applications.

The day will begin with short presentations by educators and non-profit organizations, followed by informational sessions on building sites and web applications to help benefit non-profit organizations.

SCHEDULE:

09:00am - Sign in / Coffee and Refreshments

09:30am - Opening message; review the days process

09:45am - Brief presentations from non-profit groups

10:00am - Brainstorm ideas for web and/or mobile tools or apps; Divide into groups to develop projects.

10:15am - Break

10:30am - Develop design, programming and production plan and assignments; begin design and development.

12:15pm - Lunch break

01:15pm - Project development

04:15pm - Finalization and testing

05:00pm - Present projects to judges

05:20pm - Hackathon winner announced

If you have a great coding and design mindset, put your talents to the task and help create tools to solve local community needs.

The Hackathon for Social Good is held during WebVisions Chicago, a nationally recognized event that explores the future of Web and mobile design, technology, user experience and business strategy.
events.address: Manifest Digital 35 E. Wacker Drive, Suite 1000

events.name: Chicago Ludum Dare Hackathon
events.about:
Greetings Game Makers!  Toy Studio is hosting a Ludum Dare Hackathon!  

 If you've ever dreamed of the glory of making an entry for the Ludum Dare 48-hour Game Competition, but didn't have the time or willpower or help you needed, then come to this event!  Our patented 'peer-pressure' technology will give you the motivation, and a few helpers will be around to support you technically and creatively.

There are 2 ways to participate in Ludum Dare.  You can fly solo to enter their competition, or grab some wing-men and participate in the Jam.  Either way, we'll have our own local celebrity panel judging the Chicago entries, so bring your A-Game!

 

The official website fro Ludum Dare is here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/

 

The rules for participation are here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/rules/

 

If you have any other questions, please feel free to contact me, Bobbylox, at bobbylox@gmail.com.

events.name: Hackerz Nation Presents - Hackathon Circus August 2012
events.about:
Like us on Facebook prior to registration to receive discount promotional code up to $20!!

$10,000 grand prize and a chance to be in a documentary filmed for MTV!

www.facebook.com/Hackerznation

Were very excited to announce our first Hackerz Nation - Hackathon Circus in Chicago, Illinois on August 24 -26, 2012!

If you dont know what a Hackathon is...

Hackathons are a unique part of our culture that allows developers and entrepreneurs to focus on building new things in a weekend. It’s often the birthplace of new products like the I like button, chat, video, and HipHop for PHP.

Join the Hackerz Nation team as we compete all weekend hacking and having a good time. Well supply the food, fun diversions, prizes and some professional guidance. You will meet future investors, employers and media. This will also be filmed for MTV. You bring your skills and ideas. Well see you there.

Youll want to start thinking of an idea or sharpen your technical skills. Teams of 4 will be formed, 1 idea generator, 2 developers, and 1 IU developer. Register early as we will hit the max capacity quickly.

events.name: That Conference Chicago Hackathon
events.about:
Can you Build a Web, Mobile or Cloud 

App in 24 Hours?

Developers: caffeinate and get ready to dominate! Bring your laptops, phones, gadgets and dev tools to the That Conference Chicago Hackathon for the inaugural 24-hour coding challenge. Develop your own web, mobile and/or cloud app, present it and compete for your share of prizes. Winners will walk away with mad props and cool loot.

And to add even more fun, your citys reputation is on the line. That Conference is running hackathons across multiple cities to find the best developers. The top two teams from each city will get to compete to win the audiences vote during That Conference in August.

What to Expect

Competition

The Chicago event kicks off on Saturday, June 9th at the Illinois Technology Association and runs through the night until Sunday afternoon. Developers are free to use any technology to build any kind of web, mobile and/or cloud applications they choose. There are no limits on team size, but wheres the fun in going it alone?

Any Technology, Any Platform

 Participants do NOT have to be here the full 24 hours, though we certainly encourage it (itll be a lot of fun!). We do ask registrants to indicate which times theyll be at the hackathon so we can plan food, etc.

Judges will be on hand on Sunday afternoon to pick the top 2 teams.  Feel free to invite your friends to watch you present. 

What to bring

Bring your laptop (and powercord), phones, gadgets and development tools and anything you need to be productive.  And your A-game. Youre going to need that.

Space is limited, so RSVP soon!

Food, beverages and refreshments will be provided.

Hosted By

 

 

Sponsors


 

Community Sponsors

events.name: Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge  - Chicago, IL
events.about:
Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge

 

Headphones on. Tilt the seat back. Just steady codin’ as the keys get tapped. Get ready, because Nokia Developer is about to turn your town into Dev City with its Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge.

 

We are hitting the road to 13-cities looking for developers who want to build an experience not just another app. To kick off the Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge, Nokia Developer will hold hackathons across the US and Canada beginning in May. You can sign up individually or form your own team to build the coolest, baddest apps for the Windows Phone platform and Nokia Lumia devices.

 

Prizes will be awarded on site at each event for the top 3 created apps, top student created app, and most Nokia-branded developer (use your imagination). App winners will be judged on creativity, usability, technical difficulty and app presentation.

 

1st place:                                                $500 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

2nd place:                                               $250 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

3rd place:                                               $100 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

Student Winner:                                   $150 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

Most Nokia-Branded Dev:                  $100 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

 

At Nokia, we don’t have ordinary developers, so these won’t be ordinary hacks. We have some amazing experiences in store – like our Re-Charge Room - for developers to chill out between pounding out code. So come showoff your skills and earn rewards. Space will be limited so register early.

The Challenge is on. . . .Ready.Set () {Code}

 

Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge Schedule:

08:30 a.m.             Light breakfast and registration

09:00 a.m.             Welcome and competition overview

09:30 a.m.             Let the hacking begin!

12:30 p.m.             Lunch

07:00 p.m.             Show us your app/Dinner

08:00 p.m.             Winners announced

 

See rules here:

http://www.callingallinnovators.com/readysetchallenge/Chicago

events.name: Science Hack Day Chicago
events.about:
Chicago’s first Science Hack Day, a 24-hour marathon for developers, designers, scientists, educators, and the community to come together to collaboratively create something awesome, will take place at the Adler Planetarium from May 12-13, 2012. 

Hack Days were originally created by Yahoo! in 2005 and soon after became a worldwide trend. By collaborating on focused tasks during a short period of time, participants are capable of producing remarkable results. Science Hack Day specifically aims to facilitate the collaboration of individuals of all backgrounds to help make science more accessible, educational, and enjoyable for museum visitors and the community.

 

Attendees 

Science Hack Day brings together software developers, designers, scientists, web enthusiasts, educators, and anyone with a passion for making cool things.   


Event schedule 

When participants arrive, there will be a few speakers and an hour of brainstorming and proposing hack ideas. You can pitch ideas, or join up with projects you’re interested in. After that, teams are free to get to work on their hacks. There will be plenty of food and drinks throughout the 24 hours. On Sunday afternoon, everyone will reconvene to check out the hacks and award prizes to the favorites.   


The hacks 

Have a great project in mind, and all you need is a designer and a web developer to make it happen? Science Hack Day is a great place to work with eager Chicagoans with all sorts of skills and hobbies to bring your ideas to life. It’s OK if you don’t come with hack ideas, we need all the creative minds we can find to help contribute in whatever way they can.

events.name: Global Data Hackathon - Chicago
events.about:
The Event

Come join the Chicago data science and tech community for 24 hours of non-stop Data Science. It started in London but is taking over the world.   Data Science London in partnership with Big Data Week is organizing the first global data hackathon from 1 p.m. London Apr 28 to 1 p.m. London Apr 29 (UTC + 1).  The competition will be hosted on Kaggle, so anyone, from anywhere in the world, can participate.  You can download the data, hack along with the data scientists in London,  see your ranking on the real time leader board, and be eligible to win the global prize.

Data science communities all over the world are joining in Big Data Week by hosting simultaneous hackathon meetups in their own cities.  Take part in the Chicago entry by signing up here.

The local event is organized by the leaders of the following meetups:

Chicago Big Data

Chicago Machine Learning Study Group

Data Science Chicago

IdeaHack Chicago

 

What to Expect

Competition

On April 28th at 7 a.m. Chicago time, Kaggle will release the data set to be used for the competition and the prediction to be made with this data set.  Teams around the world have 24 hours to build models with the supplied data to make the best possible prediction. The team with the most accurate prediction wins the competition.  

Chicago participants will break down into teams of 4-8 people.  Each team will work independently but is free to collaborate with other Chicago teams.  Progress will be tracked on Kaggles leaderboard, and well have checkpoints throughout the day to honor the best performing teams.  We plan to submit a final team Chicago model to compete with other cities around the world.

Participants do NOT have to be here the full 24 hours, though we certainly encourage it (itll be a lot of fun!).  We do ask registrants to indicate which times theyll be at the hackathon so we can plan food, etc.

Refreshments

We hope to get enough sponsorship to keep participants fed and refreshed throughout the day (and into the wee hours).  More details to follow.

What to bring

Bring your laptop (and powercord), flash drives, paper?, pen? an inquisitive mind and anything you need to be productive.  

 

Hosted By

Silver Sponsors


Bronze Sponsors

 

 


Community Sponsors

The marketing hackathon invites a group of business managers and marketers to gather together to exchange ideas, tips, and best practices in a problem-solving environment.

Learn from leaders who have created successful programs that leverage demand-focused activites for growth, and then hack away at your own goals in small groups.

events.name: Hack U Chicago
events.about:
Spring Hackathon

On April 21st and 22nd we’ll be holding our second Hackathon. Thanks to our sponsor Enova the winning team members will each receive a MacBook Air. Winners also have the opportunity to speak at TEDxUChicago.

Hack Nights and Hackathons

Hack Nights are a time set aside each week for coders and anyone generally interested in technology to gather and hack, work on homework, or just hang out. We meet every Friday evening from 4:30 to around 9:00 PM in Ryerson 255 (the big lounge), and we usually end up ordering pizza and doing demos around 6.

On February 10th and 11th we held UChicago’s first Hackathon, a two-day event devoted to collaborative creation and coding. Over 48 hours, hackers across the University pitch ideas, form groups, and build something awesome. There was a $100 cash prize that went to the best project as voted by attendees, Michael Victor Zink’s Study Buddy.

events.name: IIT Hackathon
events.about:
IIT Hackathon is a 24 hour marathon that tests the limits of your creativity and skills. The idea is to use the time to design and build an amazing product with limited resources. Show us that you have what it takes (whether it be design or development work) and well reward you handsomely.

What makes it fun is that no code can be written before the competition. No ones gonna check, but we like to follow the honor code. You can use existing libraries as long you have permission to use them.

SCHEDULE

MARCH 30TH

5:00 PM

Doors open. Onsite registration begins. Networking starts

6:00 PM - 7:00 PM

Opening ceremony

7:00 PM - 8:00 PM

Dinner from Millers Pizza. Event registration closes. Soft start of competition

8:00 PM

Official start of competition

MARCH 31ST

1:00 AM - 2:00 AM

Midnight breakfast

8:00 AM

Continental breakfast

1:00 AM - 9:00 AM

Midnight breakfast

12:00 PM- 1:00 PM

Lunch

2:00 PM

1 hour warning. Recommended time to start planning presentations

3:00 PM

Code Freeze. 30 minute break before presentations

3:30 PM

Presentations begin

5:00 PM

End of presentations. Judging begins

6:00 PM

Awards/closing ceremony

LOCATION/TIME

IDEASHOP, 3440 S. DEARBORN AVENUE, CHICAGO, IL 60616
STARTS AT 5:00 PM
